name: info
description: Your patcher module information.  You should use the `info` variable as the value here.

name: gameModes
description: Array of the game modes your patcher can be used with.  Game modes are defined in xelib's [gameModes enumeration](Development/APIs/xelib/Setup).

name: settings
description: The patcher settings schema is used to register a settings tab for your patcher in the [manage patchers modal](Modal Views/Manage Patchers Modal).

items.name: label
items.description: The label used for the tab in the manage patchers modal.

items.name: templateUrl
items.description: URL to the HTML template to use for the settings tab.  You'll want to include the `patcherPath` in this URL.  E.g. `\`${patcherPath}/partials/settings.html\``.

items.name: controller
items.description: Optional name of the controller to use on the settings tab.

items.name: defaultSettings
items.description: Object containing the default values for your patcher's settings.  Settings can be any type.  You should provide a default value for every setting your patcher supports.

name: requiredFiles
description: Optional array of filenames which must be loaded for the patcher to run.  Your patcher will be disabled if any file from this array is not loaded.  Your patcher will also be disabled if a required file is loaded after the patch plugin the patcher has been assigned to.

name: requiredFiles

args.name: filenames
args.description: The filenames of all files available for your patcher to patch.

description: Optional function which allows you to exclude certain files from patching.  The array of filenames you return from the function will be the base file selection used by the patcher.  You can use [Array.prototype.subtract](Development/APIs/Polyfills) to remove files from the passed filenames array easily.

items.name: initialize

args.name: patch
args.description: Handle for the patch plugin your patcher is using.

items.description: Called before processing.  Perform anything that needs to be done at the beginning of the patcher's execution in this function.  This step is often used to load records which but need to be used in the patching process.

items.name: process
items.description: Array of process blocks. executed sequentially.  See the process block schema below for more information.

items.name: load

args.name: plugin
args.description: Handle for the plugin to patch.

items.description: Called for each plugin to patch.  Return null or undefined to skip loading records from the plugin, else return a load options object.  Loaded records which pass `filter` will be copied to the patch plugin, and then passed to the `patch` function below.

items.name: signature
items.description: Record signatures to load separated by commas.

items.name: filter
items.description: Optional filter function.  Called for each loaded record.  Return false to skip patching a record.

items.name: patch
items.description: Called for each record copied to the patch plugin.  This is the step where you set values on the record.

items.name: finalize

args.name: patch
args.description: Handle for the patch plugin your patcher is using.

items.description: Called after processing.  Can be used to perform any cleanup/final steps once your patcher has finished executing.  Note that UPF automatically removes ITPO records and unused masters, so you don't need to do that here.
